intro: Pilosella aneimena, commonly known as the slender pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of the United States and Canada. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow blooms. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Pilosella aneimena is known for its ability to tolerate various soil types and is often found in disturbed or marginal environments.
